description:
If you come early when they open you can pick any seat you want, I choose the bar to watch my sushi prepared. I looked at their extensive menu and came down to three entrees which I had the best sushi that day. 
I can not resist not ordering my favorite "hamachi kama", nicely grilled and not too dry, juicy with bottom side lightly salted - It was perfect. My sashimi came after and the fish assortment was like art and perfect with every taste, very fresh and delicate. 
This was the best place for sushi that I can say, I would come back for more.
author: Len L.

description:
3.75/5
Came by for dinner before a show. I was able to make a reservation fairly easily through Yelp but it doesn't seem like it'd be too hard to get a spot even on a Friday night (there were people but still a quite a few spots open at the tables and bar).

My main issue with Sakana was the service. They were friendly but out of the 3 items I ordered, I had issues with 2 of them.

I got the following items:
1) Sashimi Omakase: My main entree. I actually ordered the Nigiri Omakase but they put in the wrong order. I didn't want to make a fuss and I didn't actually mind the mistake but it bothered me that I heard the waitresses talking about the mistake but they didn't ask me if it's alright. The omakase wasn't bad though. It was a daily special so I don't know the actual cost but I paid the $29 that the nigiri omakase cost (I asked the waitress about the price difference and she just said "it's fine"). My order came with 2 slices of each of the following: Toro, Tuna, Shiso & cucumber wrapped in ika, hamachi, hotate, and possibly suzuki or some other white fish. Texture-wise none of them had a fresh bite but they all had decent flavors still so the quality was pretty good overall. (3.75/5)

2) Uni shot w/ jellied fish (golden eye snapper): Another daily special. A bit pricy at $7.50 but they do give a sizeable amount of uni. The uni had an initially bitter taste but it fades quickly into sweetness. The jellied fish was more like a cold fish broth that has slightly thickened. I wish they would have left some chunks of the snapper in there for more flavor and texture but overall it's a pretty decent shot besides the price (3.5/5)

3) Yamaimo w/ Mentaiko: My 3rd item that they forgot until I reminded them. I enjoyed it quite a bit though. If you haven't had yamaimo there's a sticky almost mucus-y layer of film around the yam which I personally enjoy but it takes getting used to. It was cooked perfectly and still had a light crunch. The mentaiko packed the perfect salty spicy punch and it went well with the mellow yam. (4/5)

Overall, I enjoyed my meal here and I would consider coming back if I'm in the area. It was a bit pricy but it is SF. I'm just a bit disappointed in the service since it wasn't too busy.
author: Vivian C.

description:
Visiting SF and wanted some affordable sushi. Good thing we got seated pretty quickly. It's a small place and there was a waiting list...

A basic roll is ~$5-6. With the special rolls being north of $6. The rainbow roll is $14.

Got the Unakyu roll ($6) and the tuna bomb roll ($6.50). I devoured both in no time.

Service was not that great. Waters were not refilled. It was busy but we weren't really checked on.

Overall I recommend and wanted to go back before I left!
author: Mel N.

description:
Nice & small restaurant with decent price and delicious food.

-staff was friendly and welcoming.
-good prices for good food. They weren't stingy on their food with the exception of the chicken karaage.
-food came out promptly 

The special rolls were around 13$, the basic rolls were around 3-7$, and appetizers vary but still well priced.

I think I found my go to sushi spot for relatively cheap eat. :)
author: Ngoc P.

description: The fish quality is so-so, and to mask the taste of not so fresh fish, the chef added insane amount of wasabi to every piece of sushi. I'm a big fan of wasabi, but there is so much a normal person can handle. On the bright side my sinuses are super clear. Service was good, bit if you like and appreciate good sushi this is not a place to go
author: Ira Y.

description: Spent the night at the Zeppelin Hotel with my Fiancé and walked up the street to this little sushi spot. Told the waitress it was our anniversary and we wanted to try some sake. She recommended two choices to us and had us pick what kind of sake cup we wanted to drink out of. The sake was really good and so was the food! The miso soup was so flavorful and had tiny mushrooms in it. I ordered a side salad but it was enough for me and my fiancé to share. I ordered the Rock n Roll roll and my fiancé ordered the sashimi. They rolls were very tasty and fresh!:) service was awesome! And at the end the waitress surprised us with a small green tea cake that had Happy Anniversary written in chocolate on the plate. It was a very memorable experience for us:) will definitely be coming back again to eat!
author: Ariel T.

description: We went here for Friday dinner so there was a line. We waited for about 20 mins and got seats at the sushi bar. This place has 10ish tables with the sushi bar. We ordered sushi combination, chirashi, some nigiri and a couple of yakitori. After the first round, we ordered a few more rolls. Food is great, especially the quality of fish seems good. But, I wish roll shapes should be much firmer as good as the fish quality. Some rolls were stuck together and eventually rice and inside stuff became separated. And, an order paper was placed right above rolls when rolls came; I know the order paper was not filthy but I just don't want to "see" a paper sticking on my food. I like the fish here but I don't think I will come back again.
author: Gabie L.

description: Moderately priced and good but not fantastic sushi I live by the area and wouldn't come here unless it close or other places were closed.
author: N A.

description:
One of the best sushi places I've ever been to. There was a wait Friday night. You easily put your name on a list. You can go next door to the bar. We told the waiter and he said he would come and get us when the table was ready! Very kind. 
The shashimi was amazing. I has two orders of salmon shashimi and my boyfriend had the shashimi omakase. It was only $35 for great quality delicious food. 
They do lack on the roll and special roll options.  It I had read online the shashimi is what you should focus on there. 
If I return to SF soon I will have to come back here.
author: Ann A.

description:
I've been here for a long time and their food is delicious as always! Sakana is one of my favorite Japanese restaurants in SF. The owner Ogawa-san, Yumi-Chan and the chef Shige-san are friendly and sweet. 

Tonight, I went there with my boyfriend to celebrate my underwater art section at the restaurant. Since the name is Sakana (it means fish in Japanese), underwater mermaid photos fit perfect!

Yumi made us special desserts

I'll be back here again!
author: Erena S.

description:
This second review is 6 years later lol.. I didn't realize how long ago I loved this place. I came here last Friday night and I left kinda hungry and very disappointed. I ordered a red bomb (spicy red tuna with tempura jalapeno). I got the smallest sushi roll I've ever seen with a raw jalapeno. I also ordered Sake and the slices were so thin I could pull them apart. I was very disappointed but I was starving so I ate them with no complaints. I wanted to mention my order to the chef to see what's up but they both looked serious that I didn't want to bother. Any other Japanese restaurant the sushi chef will greet you or at least ask how do you like your food. Neither did. The waitresses were great though. Btw I spent about 40 bucks for 2 tiny rolls and sake nigiri.

I probably won't go again unless I see different chefs. Shame cuz this used to be 1 of my favorite spots.
author: J G.

description:
Awesome authentic sushi. Toro was amazing. Dassai 50 is a perfect complement. 
I thought it was a tourist trap but it turns out to be the real thing. My favorite around JPM for sure.
author: Manfred S.

description: Wasn't bad but nothing about this restaurant stands out. I had to $29 "omakase" and it was about what you'd expect for the price
author: Jessica S.

description:
A little gem of a restaurant close and quick enough to the ACT theater for pre-show dining.

The hostess was friendly & efficient, and we enjoyed the warm edamame, green salad with carrot ribbons (and a delicious ginger miso dressing), mixed tempura appetizer, & 49er roll. I was a bit disappointed that their homemade desserts were sold out, but we'd had a heavy lunch.

I highly recommend reservations! And please call to cancel if you change your mind, as a courtesy to others. We were next to a table being held for a reservation which never showed. Eventually, it was given to another couple, but frustrating for both the host and guests.

minus 1 star for amount of clutter. It is a very small place and bits and pieces that have accumulated over the years really age this otherwise terrific place.
author: Julie D.

description:
99% of the time when I eat at a sushi restaurant, I would order their specialty rolls (lion king hollaaa), but I have been trying to eat clean(er) lately, so I opted for really simple dishes.

Starting from the best: ordered the four piece maguro sashimi, kani su (Snow Crab, Seaweed & Cucumber with Light Soy Vinegar), and a chicken thigh skewer with sour plum paste. Even though the sashimi was the favorite thing I ate, the fish didn't melt in my mouth, sadly. The kani su salad....well, it's exactly as it sounds. No good or bad surprises there. And lastly, the skewer. Do yourself a favor and don't order the skewer. The skewer itself doesn't have much meat (although it is only $3 I suppose), and I thought the sauce on top didn't compliment it well. That and the chicken was simply, very basically bland.

I guess it's unfair to rate their business since I didn't get to try other ("better") foods, but still, the sashimi was just okay to me and the skewer was just....oy.

+1 for their service - servers were great! Shop is pretty small itself, nothing fancy and probably good for a weeknight chill date.
author: Cathy C.

description:
Oh Lordy where do I start?

With such a mixture of good and bad reviews my brother and I decided to try this place.

If you don't want to read any further let's just say the green tea tiramisu was the highlight of the meal.

Beef tatami was overcooked.

Fried jalapeño in spicy tuna was bland and the fried jalapeños were soggy.

Rock N roll was cold and bland like the ones your would get at a super market.

Brown rice tea instead of green tea was never refilled.

Good salad with Ginhee dressing.

The fatty tuna and salmon that my brother got didn't taste fresh.

And here's the 2 star kicker we were there for about 2 hours due to slow service and we watched them reserve tables for people who never came and didn't seat the people who were waiting outside on the sign in list.

And if you know the waiter or waitress you can walk right in and cut the line. We saw two people just bypass tge line give a hug to the waitress and she said they didn't have to wait and she sat them right away.

Bad service and meh food equals 2 stars in my book.
author: Jack R.

description:
Really delicious sushi rolls at very affordable prices! A friend and I ate here and split five rolls: Ebi Tempura Roll, Alaska Roll, King California Roll, Spider Roll, and Dragon Roll. They were all very good, but I think the King California was my favorite. The Oolong Iced Tea was very good, too.

Very fast, friendly service. It's a small place but didn't feel cramped. We got there right as they opened so it wasn't extremely busy, but I'd wait for their food because it was so good!
author: Liz S.

description:
Super rude and aggressive male Japanese waiter, double faced. Treat Asian guests so badly while serving two white American girls with big wide smile. 

* tried to charge us Hot sake that we didn't order

* tried to aggressively forced us to order miso soup because "everyone else ordered it". 

Overall a super disappointing and confusing experience. Will never visit this place again and would not recommend it to anyone.
author: Xue H.

description: We enjoyed the sushi and saki the chef was friendly and helped us make our choices. The staff was very nice but the food was AMAZING this is a must go to place if your in the City.
author: Blanca S.

description:
The service is no good for Japanese tourist. Nothing good.
Man staff like bad was uncomfortable all time. I have never seen it nasty staff of restaurant.
author: Miyuki S.

description:
Average across the board (service, food, ambience), and that's absolutely what I was looking for. Since moving to SF two years ago, I've been in the search for a go-to sushi spot. I used to have a 2x a week sushi habit, back when I could regularly get 3 rolls and a beer for under $30 (these places are a dime a dozen in NYC). Is the sushi amazing? No. But did I need it to be? Also no. I just want a solid place for decent fish at an affordable price. Until Sakana, all I'd found in SF is fancy omakase or cheap places with fish that was virtually inedible.

My friend and I split 2 yakitori skewers, fried squid, and each had 3 maki and a beer. Total with tip was $31 per person. All the food was decent, unremarkable, but perfectly fine for a casual, affordable dinner. Will definitely be back.
author: Gwen H.

description: Lovely little place. Excellent servers who are cheerful and helpful. They let you choose your cup when you order a sake :) The fish was very very good. The toro was just slightly below top notch and the salmon was also barely less than awesome. Minor quibbles though. This is an excellent little place. I will definitely be back.
author: Sean R.

description: Delicious fresh fish here! Miso soup ruled, edamame was good, sashimi was perfectly fresh and delicious, tobiko tataki was supreme, service was very friendly and prompt.
author: Rob R.

description:
Amazing restaurant! Fourth time here and every time has been nothing but a good experience. 

They have a good selection on their menu - sushi, sashimi, salads, fried and other cooked dishes. Great quality fish and presentation was clean. Portions were balanced. They have a cute little blackboard that gives recommendations on food and sake pairings when I was there which is super cool. 

Really nice and cozy ambiance. The restaurant is small and intimate, which is perfect for a nice little date. They can also accomodate for families and bigger groups if anything. I was pleased by the attentive and friendly service from the staff. This place does get busy so it might be helpful to make a reservation. Definitely recommend anyone downtown to check this place out if in the area and craving some delicious sushi :-)
author: Sydney E.

description: It's okay, a little over rated. My friends and I didn't taste anything special here. Nothing bad, but not as fresh as some other ones we tried.
author: Sophie C.

description:
Tourist trap. Landed here because all the other restaurants around had a long wait. My friend vouched for this place ....

Not very many veggie options. I was reduced to BASIC at this spot. I ordered an avocado cucumber roll. It was ok, just that, basic:/ I was still hungry, so I asked if they could hook up one of the sushi rolls listed, minus the meat. What arrived was barely edible. Massive chunks of raw jalapeño, cream cheese, and they forgot the avocado. Seriously? 

To top this horrid dining experience off, the waitress informed me that she'd take my card for the $15something part of my bill, but I should be advised, that in the future, they don't take credit cards for anything under BLAH, BLAH, BLAH. Really, you're gonna tell me that after you serve me a disaster of a meal in this foodie town?!
author: Gabriela W.

description:
The uni here was good I love uni :) However, I thought the scallops wrapped in bacon were too salty and the rest of the sushi was standard, not great. There are some pretty affordable rolls and the service was fast. 

Would come back again if I'm in the area and want some sushi!
author: Caley Z.

description:
Service - Good. 

Restaurant - Nice and cozy. 

Wait time - None on Friday at 9PM. 

Chicken teriyaki - Did not taste like teriyaki at all; tender with good texture; my favorite item. 

Rainbow roll - Average california roll with slices of fish on top; small enough for a small girl to finish.

Amberjack nigiri - $7 for 2 pieces; chewy, questionable, couldn't enjoy it. 

Price - Under $60 even with hot sake.

We were full and satisfied, but I think this restaurant was worth only one trip.
author: Ee Vonn Y.

description: Started going somewhere else and stumbled on Sakana. Service was excellent--fast and friendly. Loved the choices of specials and the regular menu. We ordered the chef's choice sashimi and a few rolls including the tuna bomb. Everything tasted great, portions were impressive. I would go back many, many times  :)
author: Cheryl M.

description:
DON'T ORDER TAKE OUT
Sushi roll pieces are the size of quarters- VERY SMALL!!! (Pic attached)
Sadly, I made this mistake tonight. I will say that I have eaten in the restaurant twice before and it was decent sushi, not too pricey and we have enjoyed our meals. 
Tonight I ordered 5 rolls, sashimi and 3 miso soups. I paid approximately $60 and was shocked when we opened our take out bag back in the room. ALL of the food was half the size. As you can see from the pictures the sushi was the size of a quarter! The miso soup was in a very small container and not even full?!? I could have bought this from the mall for half the price.
Disappointed and not returning. Feeling ripped off.
author: Amy B.

description:
Nice  Authentic Japanese Sushi  spot.  Overall the customer service was OK. The workers did not seem happy to be working so that was kind of a bummer but overall the food selection was great with fresh fish . 

The best part of the evening was meeting Vance a Chef there that introduced us to a nice Live Jazz lounge down the street which we really enjoyed.
author: Michael M.

description: Simple and straight forward selection of items which I appreciate! Very friendly service and generous with sashimi portions :)
author: Mandy H.

description: Randomly walked by the place and decided to walk in because I was craving sushi, and I was very pleasantly surprised. First of all, there was no wait, which was great. Secondly, the fish was very fresh and flavorful. They don't really do a lot of crazy rolls, but you want to come here to taste the purity of the fish flavor. May be my new favorite place close to my apartment.
author: Cynthia M.

description: They only had reserved seats for Valentines Day 2018. Meal came with free dessert! Spent about $100 and we went away full and tipsy.
author: Keith M.

description:
Bummed that we didn't enjoy our meal here. The fish is just not up to par. 

Ambiance: It was pleasant to sit by the large windows and enjoy people-watching. There is also seating at the sushi bar. Overall the place looked and felt clean. 

Service: The servers were quiet, but friendly. They kept our waters filled and checked on us. 

Food: We ordered the omakase and sashimi/nigiri combo. I know it's a gamble with these particular dishes because you don't know what you're going to get, but the selection that was presented to us was kind of weak. Shrimp...a meager salmon roll...tuna and more tuna. And I don't know if the fish was old or just poor quality, but the squid and shrimp left a film in our mouths and the options were flavorless and/or chewy. Plus every nigiri had way too much Wasabi. I started to think they were trying to hide the flavor (or lack thereof). Sad to say but we won't be returning here.
author: Susan G.

description:
It tastes much better than I expect. Toro and Hotate are fresh, Ikura looks too small... Almost every nigiri is about $6, prize just okay to me.
听朋友说不好吃所以一直没来过，今天试了一下其实还挺好吃的，鱼生都很新鲜，就是寿司的个头都不太大，所以价钱就小贵，不过也还能接受。
author: Welcome Z.

description:
A real Japanese restaurant. Authentic food. Good food. Japanese chefs and waitstaff that can converse in Japanese. 

I didn't get any sushi but I had appetizers, yakitori and kushiyaki. For the yakitori, you can choose shio or tare. Everything I had was delicious. They serve their Tsukune skewer with a raw quail's egg. You can get any more authentic than that. And the prices are very reasonable. As the Terminator said, "I'll be back".
author: Tim P.

description: This is the go to sushi spot. Great service, prices and food. Philly roll and sushi combo are the usuals.
author: Sam R.

description:
A little "hole in the wall" restaurant - not really that small but I think it's about 10 small tables and a sushi bar.   Food is great.  The fish is fresh and I attribute that to the busy crowd so there's lots of fresh inventory turning over.  

They do get busy so it's good to go off hours and I did see some folks order items that were off menu - need to figure that out for next time :-)
author: Alan F.

description: Great service and great food. Their sushis and rolls. are super fresh. Loved the grilled miso cod and yellowfin.
author: Justin N.

description: We just got into San Francisco and were casually walking from our hotel when we found this little sushi restaurant. The place is small and we must have timed it really well because it was around 6:45 and no wait. Another 45 minutes later and the tables were all taken. In any event, the service was impeccable. We ordered 4 rolls. I had my basic go to spicy tuna roll and decided to branch out to try one of their specialty rolls, the crunchy roll. It was basically tempura asparagus, shrimp, and sprinkled with tempura bits and row. OMG it was so good. I can't remember my husband's rolls and he is clearly no help remembering them this morning (probably should have written this last night from the restaurant...lol) but it was one of the traditional Japanese rolls and another with bbq eel. He also got the tempura appetizer and enjoyed everything. I would highly recommend this place... our bill was around 50, which is not bad for 4 rolls, 2 appetizers and soft drinks (no free refills). The quality is great, and we can definitely see going again when we are in town next time.
author: Courtney R.

description:
It's good! Not the best sushi place in the world but I'd definitely go back again to taste other dishes.

The meat is fresh, the rice is yummy but the portions aren't big. What I cannot (for the life of me) stand is when restaurants add more portions of a cheap ingredient just to call a portion "large". Sorry, I don't believe you. They'll put more rice than 7 slices of sashimi in Chirachi bowl and they'll call it large. Or they'll add a salad out of nowhere and say "we're generous!" #nope

T'was yummy tho and the staff was sweet.
I'll go back soon.
author: Xriss J.

description: Staff and service was great! A very friendly place to eat. The pricing of the sushi is pretty good compared to other places in the area. The presentation of the sushi rolls isn't amazing but it still tastes great.
author: Stephen S.

description: One of my favorite sushi spots in the city. Sushi is cheap and very fresh. The starter small salad is also a great choice. Only con is to use a credit card, there is a minimum of $15. Fast take out but also nice spot to dine in at.
author: Rilee H.

description: Sakana Sushi bar and grill is a very nice tidy restaurant. It dose get to be crowded on weekends because the place is small a bit crampy thee not a lot of floor space. however, the service is outstanding. I had a nice waitress took my order. the menu is pretty selective and interesting too. The price is not too bad base on the menu instead of a bento box there a long listing of appetizer.  You pretty much split the bento box if you want to cut down the cost. For example, I order Miso Soup, Ikura Sushi and Tempura with 3 piece of shrimp and 3 piece of veggie.  I was still hungry I order Seaweed Salad.  The Tempura was $7.50. For all of   my meal I order came out to be $21.00 along with hot tea.  The decor is nice, service is excellent, Food was tasty, location is convenience just next door to Owl Tree. After dinner I walk over to Bar 587. I would repeat.
author: Mat Z.

description: I was in town for work and craving sushi! Keep in mind I went here twice because it was so good! The first time I went I had the sashimi combination ($25), the 49er roll ($13) and rainbow roll ($13). The sashimi was very fresh and the slices were pretty thick. The specialty rolls were awesome because they both had CA roll as a base but I noticed the CA roll had real crab in it! The 2nd night I went there, I had amberjack, amaebi, CA roll, ankimo, and a sushi combination. Everything was tasty but again, I just can't get enough of that CA roll!!! Service was excellent and the dishes came out fast. It's a little pricey but I think that's pretty standard in the area. When I come back to SF, I'll definitely visit.
author: Regina W.

description:
I came here for a quick bite, not expecting much. Turns out, the service was terrible and my rolls were a little sloppy. My server was inattentive and impossible to get a hold of. He wouldn't let me finish my sentence whenever I had the chance to talk to him. He didn't even ask us what we wanted to drink and I ended up asking for water after receiving my food. Also, I didn't find out that my menu had the wrong prices until I received my check. The waiter didn't apologize and simply said "you didn't have an updated menu."

Other than that, I think this place is reasonably priced for average sushi. Just need major improvements on the service.
author: Helen C.

description:
We decided to check this place out because of the 4 star reviews we saw.  We were disappointed from the moment we walked in.  The ambiance of the place was not what you would expect of a sushi restaurant - it had more of a cafeteria flavor.  We were hesitant to check it out, but we thought we should give it a shot since it had decent reviews.  
We picked the tuna tataki for an appetizer.  Instead of being seared, it was almost cooked entirely through.  Edible, but definitely far from great.  There were very few special rolls to choose from.  We also ordered the dragon roll.  The avocado was not fresh - started browning.  The eel was not great either.  We also ordered salmon and toro nigiri.  The fish was subpar.  The bill was surprising considering that everything was just OK.  Not sure at all why this place has 4 stars.  Felt very mislead after leaving this place.
author: Tania M.

description: Highly recommended. Sooooo FRESH!!! Favorite new spot. Must try. We tried the sashimi combination, caterpillar roll, spicy tuna roll... So satisfied and the service was great.
author: Sara H.

description: Just walked in. I'm not a big sushi fan but this place is legit. Had the Dragon roll Kirin beer and a veggie noodle soup. The place was quiet when I arrived and packed when I left. Worth a try for the so so fan and the connoisseur.
author: Rolando B.

description:
I should've known based on the appearance of the uni that this meal would not be the most tasteful. My friends and I decided on Sakana after Ryoko's wait was about an hour long (and I was starving).

Service was alright at first, but then when asked for assistance from another waiter there was some attitude involved. Sure, it was a relatively full house and other orders were being placed, but please don't lose sight of customer service. It matters!

Alongside the uni I had a spicy tuna handroll, salmon, and a recommended yellowtail. Nothing spectacular and I don't think it would appeal to me to return.

However, I must mention they had a neat pitcher to keep the cold sake cold. I'll try to add a photo if I find it in my album. 

Also, overpriced.... that is all...
author: Sarin P.

description:
This is a great Japanese restaurant, and you can have real fresh Japanese cuisine here. Both cooks and waiters are japanese.We chose the place as our Friday dinner date, and we are not dispointed. 

The food was incredible! We ordered fried chicken and agedashi tofu as appetizers, and Sushi Omakase and Sushi A as main dishes, with nameko as miso soup, green tea as a drink. Everything was perfect! 

Also the service is great. Since all tables were reserved, we were sitting at the bar and get to see how the chelf cook. The waiter with blue hair, Hiro, I believe he was also work at Japanese Tea Garden. 

The price was reasonable, we spend around $70 for this meal. We really enjoy this dinner! !
author: Peizhi Z.

description:
We chose this place because it was near the Hilton where we are staying and it got decent reviews. This place was supposed to be open until 1 o'clock am on a Saturday but end up closing at midnight because they ran out of rice. How does a sushi place run out of rice?!

The bill was about $100 but we got 2  large hot sakes and a large Sapporo light. We also got to special rolls (including a rainbow roll), two orders of salmon (sake), and an appetizer of seared albacore which was a little overcooked. there supposedly known for their barbecue eel with sounded really gross but it was actually quite tasty. I saw a guy eating here by himself you look like a regular which really shows that this place is legit.
author: Joleen Q.

description:
My bf and I ended up at Sakana because it is blocks from the Marrakech Theatre where we had a show to watch, but it was an inadvertent discovery of a gem!  They serve some of the best sushi my bf and I had ever tasted despite the casual atmosphere and interiors.  

Service is friendly and attentive here.  We let the chef choose our sashimi plate which seems to always work out well for us in most sushi joints.  He picked out various fishes some of which were from Japan such as Amberjack, Sea Bream, and Bonito.  The plate was a simple, beautiful conglomeration of colourful, shiny fish.  Each one tasted as fresh and buttery as it looked too!  We enjoyed some of our favorites such as ankimo (monkfish liver), mackerel and uni.  The Tako Su salad (octopus, seaweed and cucumber) was made with real seaweed.  They serve sake in carafes here which was different, but it didn't matter.  The fill level seemed to rise with each new carafe.  -much appreciated Sakana!  

All this for extremely reasonable prices.  I don't think we went past $150.  For the top notch quality food here, the prices were excellent.  It's not a matter of IF we'll return.  It's WHEN!
author: Elizabeth S.

description: Love how fresh everything is here. If you like eel, please order it here -- in a roll, as sushi or sashimi. You won't be disappointed. Also enjoy the ikura salmon roe -- melt in your mouth. Other dishes like veggie tempura tasty, too. Other people have used the word "authentic" and it fits. Plus, it's very comfortable, prompt, not overly pricey and has an excellent sake selection. All good, all very good.
author: Candace P.

description: Great quality sushi, yakitori, udon. The salmon skin salad is also delicious. Casual, relaxed atmosphere.
author: Jon F.

description: Friendly place. I had a nice early dinner at the bar here on a Friday afternoon. Ended up in a pleasant three way conversation with other patrons at the sushi bar. Casual. I would drop by again!
author: Kent D.

description:
This place was decent, but didn't stand out in anyway.  The food, service, and decor were all just "okay."

I had the chicken teriyaki plate, which I chose because it was healthy (grilled chicken served with miso soup, a generously sized salad, and steamed rice).  It was okay, but nothing special.  I also tried the rolls our group ordered - tuna bomb, spider roll, and hamachi negi - they were good.

The service was also okay.  One friend's food took longer than the rest of ours to come out.  In general, the service was polite and the food came out quickly.  The staff was not exactly warm and friendly, but they were competent, and did a good job accommodating our group of 7.

The place is cozy and takes reservations, which was important to us, since we were going to see a 8pm play after dinner.

Overall, good, but simply not great.
author: Barnali D.

description:
Well, it started out nice. We were seated immediately in a crowded room. Very good in terms of quick service.

When it comes to the food, however, it's a little hit and miss. More on that in a sec. We ordered:
-Nameko Miso Soup
-Ika Fry
-Scallop R.B. (Wrapped in Bacon)
-Aji (Jack Mackerel)
-Anago (BBQ Sea Eel)
-Kinme Dai 
-Awabi (Abalone)
-Toro (Fatty Tuna)
-Ama Ebi (Sweet Shrimp)
-Roe Sushi
-Hakutaka (Carafe)

Looks like a lot, and it is -- we couldn't finish! But, that wasn't our issue. Our real issue was starting with the "wrong" item (subjective): the abalone. We had confidence that if the abalone was well-prepared, everything else would be fantastic, too. I found it to be so chewy, I was not capable of biting through most of it. Wasn't malleable enough... Most of that was left back on my plate.

Now, many other items were decent, especially the Aji and the Anago. Liked the bacon wrapped scallops, too. It's just the first attempts at eating anything sort of tainted the rest.

We were wiped out late that evening, having just seen Tarantino's "The Hateful Eight," for better or worse...

I think by ignoring the abalone, Sakana can earn three stars. Restroom was clean, and service is everything.
author: Garett T.

description:
Sakana is surprisingly good given its close proximity to Union Square. Its also open till midnight, even on a Sunday night, and does a respectable job of takeout. It's a small restaurant, its not fancy, and is located just on the edge of the Tenderloin.

The Good:

Tsukune - skewer of ground chicken balls with shiso leaves - Very Good, Like the leaves

Chicken Yakitori - 2 skewers of grilled chicken - Pretty Good

Salmon Skin Salad - Grilled and chopped salmon skin over baby greens with ponzu - Very Good

Spinach Ohitash -Boiled spinach with light soy with bonito flakesi - Very Good

Tamago - Egg omelet - good

Nasub - Japanese eggplanti - Very Good

Maguro - Tuna - Very Good 

Sake - Fresh salmon - Very Good


The Bad:

Maguro Goma Tataki - Seared ahi tuna with spicy sauce - Chewy, Not Good
author: David T.

description: We were hungry for Japanese food and chanced upon this place thru Yelp. Decided to give it a try and are very glad we did. We ordered several dishes along with a bottle of sake we never tried before and we're just pleased overall; great service, good ambience, tasty food and good location. Our new go-to place whenever we're in the city!
author: Ella I.

description:
Really, really, really great food. Seriously.

I had gotten in late traveling and was staying at a nearby hotel. I found this place on yelp and decided to order a few dishes to go. I love sushi, but I was in the mood for something cooked and hearty. I opted for tonkatsu, miso soup, and just a few nigiri.

Fish-to-rice ratio was perfect. Rice was seasoned so well. Every piece was fresh and delicious.
Tonkatsu was also delightful. Perfectly crunchy on the outside, great katsu sauce on the side. Next time I'm in town, I'll go full-blown crazy with their daily specials!
author: Michelle C.

description: The food was great! Huge selection of fish and every small dish we had were all great as well!! The Madai, aji, kampachi and mirugai were all very fresh and stellar! The service was great too! Very warm and friendly. Will definitely be coming back soon!
author: Tomoki T.

description:
One of my favorite spots in the city. 
Great sushi/sashimi and also highly recommend the crab cakes and ankimo.
author: Junji O.

description: Food was ok, but ordered a roll tempura fried and it came with very very stale tempura bits instead. I tried to let the server know and they weren't able to understand what I was saying (I believe they didn't understand English) and just walked away... was a little odd. Rolls were very very tiny. (We ordered vegetarian and vegan).
author: Sarah W.

description: Good food; we had fish carpaccio, gindara, salmon skin salad, kimpira gobo, chicken gizzard, futo maki, and yamaio ume-ae. The carpaccio is OK and the rest is awesome. The place is quite small though.
author: Yoshikage K.

description:
Tried to go to ryoko down the street and the line was out the door. Wandered in here and it was lovely! We sat right up at the bar. 

Alaska roll was fantastic. Some of the best fresh salmon we've had. The uni was buttery and salty - and a huge portion! The rolls were affordable and fresh. Sitting st the bar we had an up front view of all the fish and everything looked super high quality. 

Honestly some of the best sushi we've ever had. Service was quick and friendly, but left us alone to eat. Perfect. 

Only criticism: the spicy tuna was the super small diced tuna; we prefer a nice piece of tuna you can see. That may not be the authentic way it's served (no idea honestly), but at leads that way you can taste the tuna and see the quality first hand.

Next time we're in the city, we'll be back.
author: Liz G.

description:
My friend and I were looking for a sushi place on our first night out. We were going to go to the one around the corner but the wait was too long and we were so tired we just didn't want to deal with it. So we stopped here instead.

The prices were very fair for the quality and service. 

For two people we came to a bill of around $80 which I thought was fine, then again I live in Vegas right now and we're pretty big on the AYCE, so for a la carte I think this is fair. 

The fish wasn't super fresh but definitely still decent enough.

We got a lot of different things: 

Sashimi plate was alright the pieces were pretty thick for what I was expecting. I also had a couple different nigiri which included the chu toro which was amazing. I love good chu toro!! You end up paying market price which is totally worth it for me. It just melts in your mouth! I also love ama ebi (sweet shrimp) and this one was pretty small compared to what I'm used to but definitely still good. I enjoyed them both but next time o might just get more chu toro and skip the ama ebi. 

Miso soup is pretty generic and the karaage was actually decent. I like to judge a place based off of their fried chicken and two kinds of nigiri sushi which determines if a place is good or not for me. 

They're definitely spot on with service and quality. So definitely will stop by again next time I'm in town!
author: Jasmine H.

description: I really miss Sakana sushi because I got really busy with work and life. It gives you a real feeling of being in Japan. The best service, awesome sushi, best sake, and reasonable prices. If you call half an hour ahead, they will make sure you have a spot, because this place is very service oriented. Can't wait to go back
author: Dastan K.

description:
So, another sushi place that I've never been to had people waiting outside. I just wanted sushi and I had forgotten exactly where or even the name of this other sushi place that I visited numerous times years ago. BUT, I wandered around long enough to find it. There were not a lot of people and plenty of space at the sushi bar. 

The raw sea urchin kicked booty. (Uni is only for real sushi fans). The downbeat Electronica was nice. The chefs at the bar were perfect. Service was excellent. The place was as good as it was in 2007 when I lived in a Pakastani hotel on Taylor Street and worked in the financial district. Maybe not the hot spot for the "in crowd" but i love this place.
author: Charles S.

description: Such a good place! Fish is extra fresh and super tasty. Everything we chose was totally flavourful. The signature rolls are especially delicious!
author: N L.

description: You can not give this restaurant less than 5 stars. Anyone else who gave it less is wrong. I am starting not to believe in Yelp. I am amazed at the quality of fish, hospitality and service. !!!
author: Sharon P.

description: Great. Authentic sushi with very fresh fish. Sake list was good at a very reasonable price. Overall great restaurant.
author: Pieter D.

description:
This traditional-style sushi joint is for true devotees of high-quality sushi and sashimi. 

Dilletantes who think great sushi means contrived rolls saturated with mayonnaise and hot sauce, eat nigiri with chopsticks and drench their fish in soy sauce would best be served by going to places with boats.
author: Yowz A.

description:
Feb 2017 Update -- 

Asari miso is gone but sushi/sashimi as good as before. Uni tasted a little old but $10 for two generous portion of otoro was great. Hamachi is good as before. The rest of sake, kani, unagi, mirugai, tako, and ikura were solid. This again is a great sushi restaurant for the price.

2014 Review--

It's a solid neighborhood sushi restaurant, among the best around Union Square for sushi. I really like their hamachi--very sweet tasting. Asari miso soup is good too.
author: Straight N.

description: This place is the realest deal. Short of being an actual person from Japan, I feel like this is a far far cry from your average California roll and eel cucumber joint. The staff are the nicest people ever and are happy to help and give great suggestions. Strongly recommend the monkfish liver and the mountain potato with spicy cod roe for the adventurous. Amazing, fresh, and wholly different flavor than I was used to. Went solo and was treated like an absolute king. Would go back in a heartbeat. Hell, I think I'll go back for lunch tomorrow.
author: Brian Z.

description: Sakana: Late night dinner choice, close to our hotel (Hilton Union Square San Fransisco). Tiny hole in the wall. We were greeted and seated at the sushi bar. The sushi was fresh and good. We ordered Salmon, Uni, Hamachi, Abalone, sweet shrimp and a Spicy Tuna Hand roll. Service was efficient, I can say that the the host, waiter or sushi chef were the friendliest or most personable, but Sakana did the trick.
author: Melody K.

description:
This convenient spot gets five stars for having in stock what's on the menu. Friendly and fast. Presentation and flavors are spot on. 
Awesome meal of Kinme Dai, Kohada and Anago. 
Close to Union Square this is a real gem !
author: Bruce B.

description:
Came by for dinner the other night and was able to get a seat at the bar upon arrival. 

Despite being in the Tenderloin, the interior of the restaurant was in pretty good shape.

Started off with the miso soup which was decent.

Moved on to the bacon wrapped scallop which was also decent.

The hamachi kama was huge and fresh. It was nicely grilled too!

The tempura dinner consisted of 5 very fresh pieces of shrimp tempura along with assorted vegetables. The tempura was lightly fried.

The caterpillar roll was also pretty good with the pieces being bite-sized and the unagi being nicely toasted.

Credit cards are accepted with a $15 minimum.

$28/person after tax and tip for dinner.
author: Derek S.

description:
The food here is pretty incredible. We got a bunch of nigiri like Amber jack, bonito, tuna, hamachi. We also got a couple of rolls with salmon and soft shell crab.  The California rolls here don't have imitation crab - it's the perfect place to get a well made roll of sushi.

The price is really reasonable for how good the food is. The neighborhood isn't great but then that's the tenderloin/union square area for you.  The ambience is simple and the focus is definitely on the food.  Service is great even though there's a handful of people working there.

We were a party of 2 and it's a place where you probably don't want to go with more than 4 people.  We could tell from the food that the chefs knew what they were doing.  The flavor really came out in the dishes they prepared.
author: Rajat S.

description: Nah.. disappointed..an overpriced place. We ordered nigiri sushis, udon, some appetizers, grilled chicken but nothing is impressive. I would recommend izakaya kou, another sushi place we went last week.
author: Emma D.

description: An unusually authentic Japanese restaurant with delicious food that tastes like it was prepared in Japan. Recommend skipping the mayonnaise sushi at this restaurant and ordering their authentic izakaya-style appetizers like yellowtail collar, aji (horse mackerel) sashimi, fried octopus legs, spinach, and Japanese potatoes with spicy fish roe. Then order their genuine nigiri sushi and finish it with miso soup. Great spot for a fix of real Japanese flavors.
author: James W.

description:
This is a weird place to be.

From the outside, it looks like a happy hour place. The name has "bar and grill in it". The menu items are mostly bite-size etc.

When we walked in though, and asked if they serve drinks, their reply was "yes but only if you order a meal".

So is this a meal place or a drinking place? Or a happy hour place? Why do we have to order a meal if it's a happy hour place?
author: Henry L.

description:
Really sold Japanese restaurant that's been around for a veryyyy long time. The take-out option seems to be pretty popular here.

As a tourist, Sakana Sushi & Grill is located in Union Square, right at the borderline of the Tenderloin. I wouldn't be too concerned though - as someone who is coming from Orange County, we were a little nervous venturing too close to the border but you're still a good few blocks away and you'll be safe walking.

The food here was amazing! Everything was fresh and service was excellent. I ordered the bento box and even the simple chicken teriyaki was perfect. The tempura was also delicious and crunchy and the miso soup was perfect for a chilly San Francisco evening.

Definitely a future go to place if you're looking for a neighborhood Japanese restaurant in the area. Also a good spot for a date or a casual dinner with friends.
author: Lalida S.

description:
Okay so first of all, parking is really hectic in this area, so I would prefer catching a cab from the hotel or simply walking it if you live just a few blocks away.

Now with the good. I felt like a hungry caveman the minute we landed in SF, and this was the only sushi place we found that didn't have lines all the way across the back. There was a waiting list though and I believe we waited for a good 15-20 min, our waitress was really friendly and greeted us and seated us once it was our turn. 

I ordered the Cali roll, spicy tuna roll, chicken teriyaki, and my all time favorite fried oysters! Now I'm a big oyster fan either raw or steamed but this one knocked it out of the park. I would come back and order like 3 rounds of this stuff. 

It's great but you can't have more than 4 ppl for each party its kind of a small place but great to take someone out for a first date.
author: Ellaine C.

description:
Pretty standard menu, nothing really special and nothing was really missing. Quality was fine, again, nothing especially fresh. Portions are definitely smaller, however the prices are decent for SF. 

Service is great and very quick. Small location though, not recommended for people that get caustrophobic
author: Jenn T.

description:
I got take out here last night via orderahead. I got the chirashi sans rice and the wakame salad. Chirashi comes with miso soup which has a good amount of tofu and seaweed in it. It wasn't as flavorful as some. The chirashi was like $23 and came with about 12-15 cuts of sushi including unagi and 2 pieces of tamago. Each cut of fish is actually different as a lot of places repeat fish cuts. I wasn't that impressed as some of the pieces were jagged and it was thin. 

however, the seaweed salad was pretty good and one of the rare ones where it wasn't super oily so that was greatly appreciated. 

overall eh but maybe a instore visit woudl be diff.
author: Tao Tao W.

description:
One of my favorite sushi places in the city. Reviews point out that the decor, food, and service are Spartan, but I personally see that as a value point. Nothing overly fancy -- which can be a drawback if it comes at a high price -- fish is simple, solid quality.

Bonus for using real crab meat in the California portion of their rolls!
author: Timothy W.

description:
Somewhat disappointed.

Its mediocre sushi.  I think the pre-packed sushi in my supermarket taste the same. 

The prices are probably normal for SFO, but to me, it seems kinda high for the less than stellar sushi provided. Portions are tiny. I would say, half of the normal cuts on a nigiri. Anyway, this is SFO.. more expensive than NYC.
author: Luke T.

description: Came here for dinner when in town. Small place sushi was really fresh but really simple rolls nothing fancy.
author: Danielle F.

description:
Small little place threats about 30. 
 To be honest we ended up here because another place had a 30 minute wait. 
My wife and I ordered the combination plater that had sashimi and a Dragon roll. Probably the freshest rolls we've  had.  ( and we eat a lot of sushi)   Had to order another Dragon before we left. 
Defiantly would recommend this place.
author: Rod S.

description: This is our absolute favorite sushi restaurant in the city and has been for years. Everything chef Mike and his crew prepare is fresh and delicious, the atmosphere is friendly and comfortable, and the service is impeccable. A true gem - authentic Japanese food with no pretension. Enjoy!
author: Sarah T.

description:
Great place for diabetics - lots of grilled proteins to choose from and you really DONT need to order any rice at all. Enjoyed the rich grilled mackerel, juicy grilled yellowtail/hamachi "collar", sweet and salty unagi rice bowl, and refreshing burdock salad.  The chicken skewers are, as some have reported, rather underwhelming.  No need to order this because the grilled fish is just so outstanding. The fish was served in generous portions, well seasoned with salt and simply served with lemon wedges, and the in the case of the mackerel,the skin was beautifully charred over charcoal giving the rich meat a delicious flavor.
The unagi was an amazingly huge portion, three pieces of unagi about 6" each laquered in a sweet and savory glaze. Wow.
for dessert I enjoyed the black sesame custard, which was reccommended by our waitress and not on the menu. It was the size of a mini cupcake, simple and palate pleasing. 
Condiments are mild dipping sauces and grated radish. Perfect. I'm bringing work colleagues to this place. I'll definitely be back!
author: Nan L.

description:
THE ABSOLUTE WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE ON THE PLANET. If you're in San Francisco and looking for a good atmosphere along with good food this is NOT the place. The vibe in this place was so stale I almost warned the happy couple that sat next to me and my fiancé to save their money. Even if the food was good you couldn't enjoy it without the staffs energy making the room a complete awkward dinner for anyone in the room including the chef. 


ABSOLUTELY BY FAR THE WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE IN SAN FRANCISCO.
author: Sabrina S.

description: Came here for sushi and sake bombs with a friend. I was skeptical because I was pretty empty on a Thursday night for dinner, but it was surprisingly good! The sushi were tiny portions, but it was so tasty! Some Asahi's and hot sake made this night a fun one, but I think I'd rather go to Ryoko's for better drinks.
author: Leah A.

description:
For a sushi restaurant that serve food until midnight Sakana is more than decent. I had their dinner combination with sashimi, tempura and hamachi kama. It was a simple and well prepared meal. The hamachi kama was particularity interesting. It was perfectly moist and tender inside. Definitely one of the better ones I had that came with a economic combo dinner. Tempura could be crisper but I like the light batter and light radish sauce. Sashimi is a standard fare. I don't find the fish quality particularly excellent. Some pieces even appeared a bit stringy. 

If you are ever in the area for a late meal, can't go wrong with Sakana.
author: Mona W.

description: I stumbled across this place after going to a competeing sushi place down the street and not being able to get a table. I had a very pleasant experience as the food quality and presentation was great and the service was quite good as well. The main lacking point was the experience as the interior seemed dated and the lighting felt very bright which took away from the experience. I think this place could do a lot better if they simplly do a minor facelift to the Restaurent so I hope the owners end up reading this :)
author: Michael I.

description:
Great restaurant! I usually like to sample fresh sashimi while sipping on some cold sake, but the nigiri here is excellent too. Not that pricey either.

If you like your sake dry you should definitely order a carafe or a bottle of Hakutaka. It's my favorite and the best value on the sake list for sure!
author: Kahn O.

description:
We wouldn't recommend anyone to come here.  Very rude server. First,  one of the server gave us menu, then went to the kitchen. Didnt come back for 10 mins. We tried to raise our hand to ask the other waiter to come, he saw it, but he didnt give us any reaction.  We alomst wanted to leave. He had no smile at all. When we tried to point on the sushi that we wanted to order because we don't know how to pronounce, he said "you just have to read it out, I won't see it". Very mean. He also had a really bad breath, so it's really ruin our meal. I think he is Japanese with the tattoo on the arm. The other American guy seems more friendly, but he just left the menu and never come back. 

The scallop carpaccio is a joke. 2 and a half scallop cut into 5 thin piece and charged over $10-$12 i believe. Only sea salt and olive oil with no plating as an appetizer.  Stay away from it. The rest of the sushi are ok, not really fresh or surprised. 

We were so regret that we just spent about $100 here with this quality of food and the awful service. I think he really had a bad day. If you don't like to be serving customer,  you should just work inside the kitchen.  We don't deserve your bad attitude.

Would never go back to this restaurant.  Hope you won't serve by this terrible Asian or Japanese tattoo waiter. 

Also other customers mentioned that the chef touched his phone while he was making sushi, there was a picture to proof too. We didnt see it until we read the yelp reviews. Your hands should be clean while you are making the sushi.  Phone is really dirty. You shouldn't touch your phone while you are making sushi. So disgusting!
author: Che K.

description:
This is our go to spot for sushi. The fish comes in fresh and melts in your mouth. This place has seriously ruined any other lack luster sushi from a container I could ever buy anywhere. It just isn't worth the calories at that point.

If you know you want to eat here for sure, make sure to call ahead and make reservations. It goes faster if you're ok to sit at the sushi bar and if you end up having to wait, just let them know you'll be next door at the Owl Tree getting a drink :)
author: Leina K.

description:
Sushi was excellent.  We ordered 5 different rolls and they were all excellent.  We ordered the Dragon Roll, Tuna Roll and sadly I can't remember the other three but they were all good.  Service was friendly and prompt.  
Not a fancy place but I think the price reflects that.  Our bill was right around $40 which is cheap for this area.
author: Dawn R.

description: One of the most authentic Japanese restaurants in San Francisco. Japanese owned and staffed, Sakana delivers a slice of Japan in San Francisco. Mike snd his team are willing to take you as deep into Japanese food and culture as you desire. Just ask! Sushi from Japan always fresh and clean. Grilled and prepared foods are equally as good.
author: Josh K.

description: If you want to meet a rude waiter(short fat asian guy) as soon as you enter a restaurant, then I recommend going to this place. Otherwise, there are a lot of other Japanese restos in the area, with even better ratings as well!!
author: Jeremy C.

description: I had high hopes based on so many good reviews, but sadly, I felt there was nothing spectacular about this place. The sushi was ok, average. The waitstaff was meh but at least my food came out fast. I had nigiri, 49er roll and seaweed salad. Too many sushi options out there, I don't think I'll be coming back.
author: Toni H.

description: We wanted sushi and searched Yelp for recos, of course!  Our first choice had too long of a line, so we opted for Sakana Sushi.  We had a short wait, about 5 mins., then were seated at a nice table by the window.  The gentleman serving us was not the friendliest server, but he was efficient.  Because of his demeanor, however, I felt asking him questions would put him out, so didn't.  We began with edamame and a tempura app.  How a restaurant prepares tempura is often a tell-tale sign of their quality of Japanese food.  It was good but not amazing.  Not greasy, but have had better-  think the batter was a bit heavy.  We sampled a variety of nigiri sushi, a roll, and sashimi.  The overall quality of the fish was good, but for the Bay Area, it was solid.  Would go back.
author: Dale H.

description: Basic, good old standby sushi. Good quality, relaxed, not trendy place. I love how they roasted the jalapeño on the tuna bomb roll. Crab in California roll needed a little salt or flavor of some kind.
author: Andrew K.

description: I ordered a spider and a dragon rolls. The tempura on the crab was not freshly made and had the texture of cardboard. The dragon roll was OK but not great.
author: Jean-Pierre D.

description:
Overall good experience. Walked in before the rush on a Friday night with my Husband and kids. Service was great, normally when I take my children to eat sushi we are snubbed, not here.

I would recommend if you are on the run for the night.
author: Janice R.

description:
I was brought here by a friend who claimed this is one of her favorite sushi restaurants. This place has a homey and authentic Japanese feel. Food was great; the fish seemed fresh. I got the chirashi bowl and salmon skin handroll - see picture. 

Food - 4 Stars
Service - 0-1 Star

Ok, here's the problem about this place, service. The service is very lousy by the one waiter (middle age, shaved head) who has a major condescending attitude when being asked about the items on the menu. When questioned about the order, he BLAMED the customers for not being clear when it was his job to clarify in the first place! 

"You never told me." "You should've told me. Next time let me know ahead of time." Excuse me? With this kind of service level, there is not going to be a next time. 

 My friend who frequents the restaurant has also experienced the same awful service each time by the same waiter! 

Dear owner, I'm certain we're not the only ones experienced this lousy service by the same person. And I'm sure there are past patrons who refuse to return to your business because of same reason. Now I think about it - it's also possible that Sakana doesn't care about service because there's enough foot traffic from the travelers and tourists alone. Well, good luck.
author: Irene S.

description:
A fun place to fulfill that Japanese food craving, and ever so conveniently located near Union Square.

Recipe for success: edamame, grilled silver cod (or any type of cod, for that matter), sushi and sashimi combo, pair with sake (the larger unit is great for sharing, the last option on the sake list is smooth/sweet), finish off with the homemade green tea flan.

Not the best Japanese food you'll ever have, but definitely worth the mention. The service, as per ush of Japanese establishments, is awesome.
author: Linda X.

description: Ate at the sushi bar. I order mostly the rolls, including one of the house specials.  It was all fresh and delicious.  Service was very pleasant and atmosphere was great.  Prices were very reasonable. Would come back again in a heartbeat.
author: M S.

description: This is now my go to place for dinner before theater. Delicious sushi. Warm, tender unagi with just the right amount of excellent sauce; fresh, buttery sake; perfectly cooked, tender, crunchy tempura shrimp in the dragon roll. Nice cold sake selection. Excellent service too. And they take reservations!
author: Ann D.

description:
The paint in the room is like a tope desert kinda feel. Which was kinda cool I guess, but not necessarily my thing.

The ambiance is chill when I was in there they were jamming out to some deep house as they were rolling. I liked that.

The rolls themselves were fucking dynamite. We got a few rolls; sake roll, tuna bomb (x3), rock and roll and a few others. For my tastes, I think this place had the best tasting rolls out of the places I've been nearby. The sake had these dope little vessels too! We got the big version of the nigori sake and it came it these big carafes that looked like or were bamboo shoots. I really liked the amount of rice they used on each roll.
author: Jim B.

description:
Sakana definitely qualifies as a lil neighborhood gem! I'm always on a mission to find some good sushi and I'm glad my friends and I checked out this place recently.

Bacon wrapped scallops are also on the menu. Need I say more? Several rounds of those later, it was time to grab some drinks and rolls. Their menu is filled with a lot of delicious options whether you want fish or are vegetarian. Their sushi was fresh, flavorful, and we were all very pleased with the service and prices. Our server was very friendly and we had a great time!

I would definitely recommend this place to friends and would love to come back again sometime if I'm in the area. It's a small spot but it's comfortable and welcoming. We called ahead of time since we had a larger party and they were very accommodating.
author: Akvile D.

description: As opposed to other reviewers, we made a reservation for Friday night 8:00 PM and despite other patrons waiting at the door, were promptly seated and attended. The food was good as well as the service.
author: Jerome O.

description:
Yes!

Great start to learning about sushi spots in the Bay!

So Sakana is a pretty cool Sushi spot.

Call ahead if you want to sit at a table ( otherwise you're at the bar)

If there's a wait at the bar you might just end up waiting outside- But we refused and waited inside until a couple left the bar! (Hey it's cold outside) 

I really love the chefs and the Waiters will drop some sushi knowledge on you after a bit of persistence.

All in all you can get Sake, A Roll, Rice & Edamame fun under $15 which is the minimum for paying with a card!

Stay Amazing,

P.S.- If y'all have any suggestions
author: Whitney R.

description: I'm not quite sure why this place has 4 stars. The sushi was ok, my beef teriyaki was horrible, the rice was dry and bitter and even the soy sauce at the table was too salty. I was excited to take my boyfriend on a date here but afterward I was very disappointed.
author: Ashley G.

description: Highly recommend against this place. Awful service. There are plenty of better places nearby, for instance, Akiko's 5 mins of walk away.
author: Vivien S.

description:
This is my neighborhood sushi joint, and that makes me happy!

This is not a fancy, high-end sushi place. This isn't date night sushi. For us, this is weeknight we're-too-tired-to-cook-so-let's-grab-something-not-too-expensive sushi. It does that SO. WELL.

The staff is fantastic--I've been seated at tables and at the bar, and the guys behind the sushi bar are really fun and nice. The wait staff are all pleasant and attentive. The place itself is clean and smoothly run.

The prices are GREAT (some of my veggie sushi is sub $3, I believe!), and the quality is really good. The rolls aren't incredibly creative or fancy--lots of classics/standards--but they're well-made and the ingredients are good quality.

The sake comes in adorable bamboo carafes and is also nicely priced.

I am always really happy when we decide to eat here... and we eat here even when we aren't too tired to cook, just because it is delicious and fun!
author: Vivienne P.

description:
Came here for dinner with some friends and we bought a huge cake which the waiter kindly helped us store in their fridge. There were 6 of us, and we were all not too hungry, so we decided to order 4 main courses to share. We had 2 sushi combination dinners, 1 sushi omakase, and 1 roll combination. This place serves both the traditional nigiri sushi and the American sushi rolls, so you get the best of both worlds. 

The sushi was very good, and the sushi omakase came with some delightful selections, including uni, spot prawn, hamachi, etc. While I felt that the waiter was initially slightly displeased by us ordering too little food, he went ahead to serve us the cake and provided us plates, cutting knife, and consistently refilled our drinks, which I find to be great service.

Will definitely come back again to give their sashimi a try!
author: Christina N.

description: If I could give this place no stars I would. The service is awful. Walked in and got yelled at for sitting at the wrong table by a man with purple hair. Our entire order was given to another table and we had to wait another 40 minutes for our food, and that same purple haired waiter gave me an awful attitude when I told him about my issue with the service. Worst service I have ever had. Food was also barely mediocre and the people preparing it didn't wash their hands as they handled everyone else's food, containers, dirty rags, etc.
author: Kari P.

description:
I don't know how this place got upto 4 stars, too close to tourist town perhaps? There are many better options at a similar price point within blocks.

Highly average fish, this is the only place I've been to where the eel came filled with bones - not great in a roll!
author: Tom M.

description: Most awful experience!!! We came around 11pm to get a late night bite after a long day. We barely walked in and the owner was kicking us out like we were homeless saying that sorry no room to sit and we are about to close and that even if a table open up we have no time to order and the kitchen would close already. Im sorry we werent homeless trash to kick us out!!!! We came to have a nice night out and we get treated like CRAP! Dont go here if you are hungrey and dressed up very nice because they will kick u out, in a very RUDE WAY!! Most awful experience ever in the beautiful city.
author: Varsenig K.

description:
Stopped in at around 10 pm for a late dinner. It had a considerable number of patrons so we figured it couldn't have been terrible.

Service was straightforward and curt--though slow at times for refills and requests.

Food is only OK. I appreciated though that they put all tempura from my udon on a separate plate so it doesn't get soggy while the soup is still scalding hot. The soup was OK. My kani salad had an unsatisfying amount of crab meat. While I commend the fact that they used real crab... It wasn't nearly enough; about 4 or 5 strips of crab meat. The salad was also underseasoned. I was surprised they didn't offer brown rice but no harm done. Tempura could've been crispier. None of the other dishes were worth writing home about either.
author: Ngan T.

description:
Meh.  Hire more waitresses!!! Won't be back, service sucks, fish just so-so, or as my sexy Spanish lover would say (if he was a total dork like me), "asi-asi.". Not worth it. Lame!!!

Also Both times we came here they tried to leave off the discount they're supposed to give on sake due to their anniversary. You guys suuuuuuuck.
author: Viv R.

description: We enjoyed absolutely everything.  We had a massive array of yakitori and sushi, and it was all presented so thoughtfully.  There was a bit of a snafu with getting the bill before getting all the food, but otherwise, we had a great time.  Just a little more attention to detail.
author: David B.

description:
This is one of those restaurants you go to when other better restaurants are full. In this case, I'm referring to nearby Cocobang and Ryoko's Sushi. They're all about the same in regards to price, but the other 2 said restaurants will be more memorable and tastier.

The service is decent prices aren't bad at Sakana--$6 for a Philly roll. The problem is that the food will be obviously generic/bland. In other words, I am pretty sure they order all their food from the same wholesale vendor every other random generic sushi shop gets stuff from. You won't find the ultra fresh fish that only the elite sushi restaurants command (obviously comes with the hefty price tag). I'm actually still on a high from the best sushi experience I've ever had in my life, recently, at a different downtown SF sushi restaurant called Akiko's--check out my review for it.

Sorry Sakana Sushi. You're a small fish in a big city.
author: Marlon T.

description:
There's definitely better or livelier places to get a roll around town, but Sakana is a good sweet spot for value in SF when you're in the mood for some fish. This place is ridiculously cheap and surprisingly decent for the area. Some tuna nigiri, a tuna bomb roll, a salmon roll, and a rock n roll later, all washed down with a carafe of sake... our hero was quite pleased with what he got.  For rolls under $6, you really can't go wrong here.

PROS:
- It's crazy cheap and absurd value for what you get. It's surprising how they manage to stay in business.
- It's located in a nice area between too posh and too dicey between Union square and the 'loin.

CONS:
- The sake is so-so, but hey... it's pretty cheap too.
- Their spicy tuna is a bit weird in consistency and texture.
author: Albert W.

description:
I guess I'm a sushi snob. No roll selection at all !!!! Salty tempura. Blah. 

Save yourself time and get out of union square. I think this is hyped. Not good quality.
author: Sarra E.

description:
I love that this is a late night sushi bar. 

For some reason, the thing I remember most about this place was the awesome Japanese Homer Simpson shirt the chef was wearing, he was a man of few words but you could tell he had quite some knife skills. 

For both times my boyfriend and I were at the restaurant, we were seated at the bar quite quickly. 

The server was very nice, and immediately served us fresh hot tea as well as water. Even when we were seated at the bar, he made sure to come and check on us. (:

The nigiri was fresh, and a lot of people seemed to be ordering sashimi (a very good sign). We also ordered some rolls, although not very unique they still had good flavor and a great ratio of fish to rice. 

Overall, pretty fresh food and decent price for sushi. I just really liked that the service was good and the restaurant is open late!
author: Maggie Y.

description: First of all, the male host is a complete power grabber. He was really persistent in not dividing up the two 4-people tables into a table for two, which remained in-occupied in the 15 minutes we waited for them!!!!? By the way, the female waitress was super sweet and friendly. The sushi was just ok. The place is popular with tourists given the location but if you live in SF : overpriced for what it delivers. There are many other better places in SF to go to. Not bad, just not great value. You
author: Anya R.

description: Their sushi is super fresh and tasty. We were originally going to go somewhere else but the line was way too long so we decided to go to this place. Its really small and nothing too trendy looking. Your typical sushi joint. Prices very reasonable, not pricey. Service was great!
author: Lusine V.

description:
Ginger is dry 0/10
Rice to fish ratio 7/10
Fish cut 6/10
"Wasabi" to fish ratio 3/10
Squid is dope! 7/10
Mackerel wasn't flavorful 5/10
Tako 8/10
Squid is slimy 5/10

Gave plates of squid and tako with no wasabi.

Rock  'n' roll 6/10
Philly roll 4/10
Spicy scallop roll 4/10
Dragon roll 4/10

Their "special rolls" are standard. Dragon, rainbow, 49, caterpillar, etc. Garbage.
Roll selection is awful. Just asked for a legitimate special roll and they said "it's only what's on the menu."

They messed up my order and gave me 8 octopus when I ordered 4 octopus and 4 squid and they took 4 of the octopus from me  instead I of comping them.

By the end of the night I ordered 11 things and only got 8.
Service 3/10
Food 4/10
Environment 3/10
author: Justice S.

description:
Are there probably better sushi places within a 2 mile radius? Most likely. We seemed to have a really good time here though and the chef's choice we ordered tasted fresh. I can't complain. Even their sea urchin was perfect, and I've had more than one bad experience with that. Their menu is pretty simple without unnecessary frills.

It's a quaint little place perfect for grabbing a bite before heading out into the city for the night. I particularly enjoyed the quick service and seating. I would come back here again.
author: Josselin A.

description:
We were originally planning to eat at another place around the corner but it had a huge wait. Fortunately a patron at the other place suggested we wal around the corner to this little gem. 

The service was prompt and efficient without any chattyness. They offer a wide range of sushi. We selected multiple rolls to share and were delighted by each. The price was very affordable and we left full. I would go out of my way to return.
author: Stephen B.

description: Food was ok not too fresh, plum wine was definitely not good quality wine. It's a easy to get in spot for Japanese food but a 3 star on the food.
author: Ying Z.

description: We decided to go to this sushi place based on the reviews. I don't really care about how good the food quality is here, but customer service was horrible. The guy (with glasses) is extremely rude. If you are looking for a good customer service, I do NOT recommend you this place, or at least respect yourself and make your order to go.
author: Shyli E.

description:
Delicious food all around! Sushi is very authentic, has a consistent quality, and they have generous portions. A lot of detail goes into the food and the best part is it's inexpensive compared to the other Japanese restaurants in the area. My favorites were the spider roll, natto roll, ikura rolls, and the hamachi kama. The sale is also on point! 

Restaurant is small with a sushi bar. If you're looking for a low key relaxing dinner, this is your spot.
author: Bobby J.

description:
Excellent sushi! The chirashi bowl was very good, with a nice selection of fish, egg omelet, and (strangely) a piece of eggplant. The fish was fresh and well-cut, which is just a must for sashimi. I also liked the miso soup that came with my bowl, although I was disappointed with the sushi rice in my bowl. It was really bland. 

I enjoyed sitting at the counter and watching the chefs while striking up a fun conversation with the people on either side. It was a super hustling place, which was good if you are looking for a high energy place. Don't go here for a romantic night!
author: Deb G.

description: The chicken teriyaki was dry as fuuuuck! I saw the number of reviews and the four stars and I don't know, there was nothing about this place that would call me back. My date had the salmon teriyaki and that was dry too. A friend of mine had the tempura and he didn't complain. If you're planning to go here for anything other than sushi walk on by.
author: Alex M.

description:
Went here on a Sunday at around 8pm because ryoko's was too packed and what a mistake we made. 

  The sushi was mediocre, out of everything we got, the black cod, Salmon, and uni were good but the service was so bad.

  This was my second restaurant experience in San Fran and I'm really surprised and disappointed at what a theme this has been. 

 When we arrived we asked approx how long the wait was. We were told 30mins. Signed our names on the lil list and there was 1 party of 2 ahead of us. The guy continued to seat the next 4 parties that came in after us. Even though there was room at the bar we could've sat and then there were tables he could've sat us at... 

  About 10mins after we ordered they were out of something my friend order and instead of asking if he'd like to order something else, the waiter just said it and hastily walked away. There was an intense "we don't want to be serving you right now" vibe here. Kinda weird. Definitely would not come back or refer a friend here.
author: Crista R.

description: Unassuming place, friendly staff, best sushi I've had (next stop: Japan?). I will definitely come back here my next time in SF.
author: Ron B.

description:
I was unimpressed with the food for the listed prices. While my chicken teriyaki dinner plate ($13) was decently sized, about 1/4 cup teriyaki sauce covered the bottom of the plate and made a dark, salty puddle that mixed with the salad sharing the same plate. My date's $16.50 sushi combination was small, and did not justify the price. 

I also found a hair in my miso soup.
author: Evelyn C.

description:
Came for a weeknight dinner with some friends. The place is pretty small, but busy. There was only really one server, so things seemed to drag on. It took quite awhile for anyone to take our order and for our food to actually come out. Appetizers took much less time, but I guess because they want to serve all the rolls on one platter, so it takes longer. Anyway, none of us were in a real rush, so it was okay. The rolls were so pretty! Small. And pretty. But...small. 

The jalapeno and tuna one has a nice kick to it, but my favorite was the caterpillar roll for the night. The bacon wrapped scallops weren't too salty, so that was a big plus. One gripe that I would have to bring up is that the tea is oversteeped, or too strong. And i drink a lot of tea. 

Overall, a nice spot, but I want to believe that there are more quality and bang for your buck places around the area.
author: Annie S.

description:
Any place that puts cream cheese in their sushi rolls is a place I try to avoid. But my mom and I were in the neighborhood and decided to give it a shot based on the Yelp reviews. BAD decision. 

We ordered the sushi omakase, seaweed salad, and vegetable tempura. The sushi chefs are nice and chatted with us in Japanese. But I'm not gonna lie, their dirty t-shirts and tattoos made me slightly wary of what I was eating. The fish tastes old and the rice was cold. Tempura was okay but not quite crisp enough. Seaweed salad was nothing special.

I wouldn't be back. I like hole in the wall sushi joints but I'd be willing to pay more if it meant fresher fish and a cleaner kitchen.
author: Alyssa Y.

description:
Great place to come for a quick quality sushi meal -- can't believe I haven't been here until now!  

I'd definitely recommend the Omakase meal ($25) as the kinds of fish you get (ours included baby Hamachi, amae ebi, uni, etc) would easily cost you double that price. Quality of fish is high -- not mind-blowing (e.g. the uni), but still high.

Service is good too -- chefs and servers alike are super polite, the server refilled our tea about every 60 seconds, and the chef was nice enough to cut all my nigiri in half since I wanted to split the omakase special w/ the bf.  

I think we are going to make this our neighborhood sushi go-to :D
author: Kendra W.

description:
Had my eye set on Ryoko while I was in town but with the line out the door, I asked for the next closest and happily found Sakana across the street.
